poem:
**Guardians in Winter**

In the cold echo of February,  
2,400 silhouettes stand like shadows,  
a million dollar vigil beneath the Capitol dome—  
silent, still, as if to keep time  
with the humming of history,  
an army of sentinels holding  
the city's breath in a frosted air,  
waiting for the thaw of another spring.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "National guard deployment in Washington DC extended until February National guard troops sent to the nation’s capital will reportedly remain there through at least February. The order was set to lapse at the end of November but was extended by Pete Hegseth, who leads the US Department of Defense. As of Wednesday, there are nearly 2,400 national guard troops in Washington DC, according to CNN. The network also notes that their presence costs about $1m". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
